questions.question: All of the following were included in the Compromise of 1850 EXCEPT:

choices.answer: The elimination of the previous Missouri-Compromise.
Greater enforcement of Fugitive Slave Laws.
Deciding new free states and slaves states via popular vote.
Admittance of Texas as a slave state.
Greater railroad regulation.
An end to the national tarrif.
Currency backed solely by gold.
An eight hour work day.

questions.question: All of the following were part of the Populist Party platform EXCEPT:
What document is BEST reflected in this political cartoon?

choices.answer: Monroe Doctrine
Wilmot Proviso
Truman Doctrine
The Platt Amendment
Manifest Destiny
Missouri Compromise
The Louisiana Purchase
Kansas-Nebraska Act

questions.question: What is this map depicting?
During the revolution, the Continental Army faced shrewd British leadership, supply shortages, and poor moral.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: Mercantilism believed in all of the following EXCEPT:

choices.answer: Both colonies and mother-countries should industrialize.
To develop wealth, a nation needed to export more than it imported.
There is a limited amount of wealth in the world.
Gold and Silver were the only measure of wealth.
True
False

questions.question: Despite early difficulties, thanks to tobacco and the Headright System the Virginia Company became extremely profitable.
Causes of the War of 1812 included impressment, attacks by Indians allied with the British, and trade tensions.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: Rock and Roll in the 1950s was an example of:

choices.answer: The Civil Rights culture.
Youth culture and backlash to middle class expectations.
The rise of radio as a new form of media.
Second Wave Feminism and a rejection of patriarchal gender-norms.

questions.question: Which of the following was an unintended consequence of the liberal successes of the 1960s?

choices.answer: Liberal democrats stopped protesting Vietnam and supported LBJ.
A majority of black voters abandoned the Democratic party.
Conservative backlash resulted in electoral success for Republicans.
It caused a recession leading to economic suffering in the 70s.
Cattle ranching
Oil extraction
Mining
Commercial agriculture

questions.question: Between 1870-1890, which was NOT a major industry in the West.
Which of the following was a direct effect of the invention of the cotton gin?

choices.answer: The invention of the steel plow.
The development of the textile industries in New England.
The spread of the plantation system into Northern states.
The introduction of the factory system in the South.
The breakup of the Soviet Union
The OPEC oil crisis
The Reagan administrationâ€™s military buildup
The Gulf War

questions.question: Which of the following was a direct cause of the defense spending trend between 1980 and 1990 as shown in the chart?
Why was Anne Hutchinson banished from the Massachusetts Bay Colony?

choices.answer: She challenged gender roles and the church authority.
The Puritans were angry when she started her own religion.
She led a revolt against the Massachusetts governor.
They believed that she was practicing witchcraft.

questions.question: What BEST describes immigration patterns and their American response in the mid 1800s?

choices.answer: Immigration decreased as a result of an increase in slave populations.
German and Irish immigrants settled in the South and the West.
The US government passed legislation to encourage Chinese migration West.
Irish migration in urban centers triggered nativist backlash.

questions.question: In 1832 South Carolina's state legislature passed the Nullification Act, declaring that South Carolina...

choices.answer: Would nullify the Constitution.
Refused to pay the national tariff.
Would nullify the Bill of Rights.
Refused to recognize John Quincy Adams as president.
Social Darwinism
Eugenics
Japanese Imperialism
The White Man's Burden

questions.question: This political cartoon BEST reflects which concept?
Which of the following was a factor for English migration to the colonies in the 1600s.

choices.answer: Enclosure movement
Economic opportunity in the New World.
Religious persecution
All of the above.

questions.question: What was the XYZ Affair (1797-1798)?

choices.answer: An incident when French officials demanded bribes from American diplomats.
Attacks on American ships by the French Navy.
A row between George Washington and an overzealous French diplomat.
Spanish-First Nations raids from Florida into Georgia.

questions.question: The Emancipation Proclamation was significant because it...

choices.answer: Suspended Habeus Corpus in the North.
Desegregated the Union army.
Abolished slavery in the United States.
None of the above.
